title: Exact quote of game loading "Tip" -- "If someone makes you feel uncomfortable in game, report them"
body:
Anyone else think this is a bit ridiculous?  It sets an extremely low bar for people to report their allies, encouraging people to report teammates for literally anything at all.  

It sows seeds of suspicion and distrust among people who are supposed to be working together.  It gives people a legitimate reason to be afraid to communicate anything in game.  I think the "Tip" itself is far more toxic than most of the comments I've seen people make in game.  

How are other players supposed to predict what might make me "feel uncomfortable in game"?  

What do the rest of you think?

replies.body: I didn't really like that tip either, but I think it can be more accurately interpreted as **"Don't think too hard on if an action is punishable or not. If it is causing you problems in the game you can report it, and that will help us determine if a player is being negative frequently enough to warrant a punishment, or if the community largely believes a certain behavior should be punishable."**
The IFS supposedly learns from what actions players report, though, doesn't it? If players consistently make frivolous reports, the system will learn to punish that formerly non-offensive behavior.
If there was a global attempt to troll the system they'd notice and just manually adjust it.
So what you're saying is that you were advocating for trolling the system?

I'm unable to comprehend the mental gymnastics you went through to reach that conclusion XD

There's almost no way the community would band together in such a coordinated and malicious fashion to accomplish this; but if they *did*, it'd easily be manually stopped.

I've actually been punished for this via chat ban. As in i made someone uncomfortable for simply complaining about how i wasn't having fun. Literally.

I wasn't insulting, wasn't calling names or pointing fingers or raging. I was just like "I really don't want to play this. Oh look, i got 3k damage in 0.8 seconds...fun."

I know it's not exactly encouraging to read that but to get a chat restrict for THAT?? The fuck?

I think Riot should just warn the person first, instead of setting back their honor level by ~3 months if all goes well.

If you try to be sarcastic in a way that sends one message but the opposite is to be understood as how you really feel, and this way is over the internet, you just played yourself or are trying to pretend that it wasn't your real intention. Calling dying really fast 'fun' makes it look like you're intentionally feeding and enjoying yourself. Just let your yes mean yes and your no mean no.
If the IFS is this stupid, it disincentivizes communication entirely as you'll never know what is the lowest bar "toxic" can reach to.

"I" is said nearly every single game, and probably by the vast majority of players who ever get banned.  Why do you suppose it hasn't ALREADY learned to punish people for saying "I?"

Consistency of reports. Literally 99% of people say 'I' and don't get reported. So the system will assume that 'I' was not the reason for the report, or that it was a false report. However, if all of a sudden 99% of games where 'I' was used are reported and that is the link the system will start banning for it. 

This was an example but it can be used for anything which could "make people uncomfortable" which isn't reported for already. Idk mastery spam, emotes, question marks in chat. The list goes on. Relatively harmless things which could become punishable due to the encouragement to report people.

Yep. This is the reason I don't say anything in game most of the time. Unless I get one of those bizarre games where everyone is chatty and nice, I just don't bother. It's not worth it. I don't need to deal with getting reported because somebody didn't like my performance and so they reported me because I might have been a bit negative as a result. I feel threatened as a player, constantly concerned I might say something that upsets someone and it triggers the wrong flag, getting me banned or muted. And I think it's ridiculous, I shouldn't have to be some ray of sunshine to chat. I should be able to say a game is over, defend myself from harassers, discuss the possibility of why we're losing, etc., without getting muted. I hate how Riot is trying to turn this game into some form of safe space. Let me vent, my team can mute me, let me defend myself, I'm being harassed and it hurts, let me speak my opinion as long as I'm not being some racist bigot. Why must I appeal to every person I meet, out of fear that they will get upset and report me? No other game does this. As long as I'm not being some racist piece of shit, I don't have to worry about getting in trouble. Now I have to censor myself on the off chance I upset someone or Riot doesn't like my word choice. Even saying "shit", on Riot's boards makes me nervous, where nowhere else would I be afraid of cursing. 

This company seeks to censor and silence and it's frustrating.
